intro: Eriogonum cyclosepalum, commonly known as the Sierra buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has small, oval leaves and produces numerous seeds in its seed heads. Eriogonum cyclosepalum is an important component of local ecosystems and provides nectar for pollinators.
